TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi ProjectCollection extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: This class encapsulates a set of related projects, their toolsets, a default set of global properties, and the loggers that should be used to build them. A global version of this class acts as the default ProjectCollection. Multiple ProjectCollections can exist within an appdomain. However, these must not build concurrently.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Multiple project collections can exist within an app domain. However, these must not build concurrently.

Docs.summary: Creates a project collection with no global properties or loggers. The project collection toolset is initialized from the configuration file and registry.

MemberSignature.Usage: new Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection (globalProperties, loggers, remoteLoggers, toolsetDefinitionLocations, maxNodeCount, onlyLogCriticalEvents)

Docs.param: The default global properties to use. May be null.
The loggers to register. May be null and specified to any build instead.
Any remote loggers to register. May be null and specified to any build instead.
The locations from which to load toolsets.
The maximum number of nodes to use for building.
If set to true, only critical events will be logged.
Docs.summary: Instantiates a project collection with specified global properties and loggers and using the specified toolset locations, node count, and setting of onlyLogCriticalEvents. Global properties and loggers may be null. Throws InvalidProjectFileException if any of the global properties are reserved. May throw InvalidToolsetDefinitionException.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Throws InvalidProjectFileException if any of the global properties are reserved.

Docs.value: The number of projects currently loaded into this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DefaultToolsVersion { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DefaultToolsVersion : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The default tools version of this project collection. Projects use this tools version if they aren't otherwise told what tools version to use. This value is gotten from the .exe.config file, or else in the registry, or if neither specify a default tools version then it is hard-coded to the tools version "2.0". Setter throws InvalidOperationException if a toolset with the provided tools version has not been defined. Always defined.
Docs.value: The default tools version of this project collection, which is always defined.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This default value is obtained from the .exe.config file, from the system registry, or if neither is present, from the hard-coded tools version "2.0".
The set method throws InvalidOperationException if a toolset with the provided tools version has not been defined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool DisableMarkDirty { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.DisableMarkDirty : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Whether MarkDirty() is temporarily disabled on projects in this collection. This allows, for example, global properties to be set without projects getting marked dirty for reevaluation as a consequence.
Docs.value: Returns a flag that determines whether is temporarily disabled.

Docs.summary: Releases both managed and unmanaged resources. Called when a host no longer needs the project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed
abstract member Dispose : unit -> unit override this.Dispose : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Called when a host is completely done with the project collection. UNDONE: This is a hack to make sure the logging thread shuts down if the build used the loggingservice off the ProjectCollection. After CTP we need to rationalize this and see if we can remove the logging service from the project collection entirely so this isn't necessary.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .NET Framework 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject() before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope."

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)
abstract member Dispose : bool -> unit override this.Dispose : bool -> unit

Docs.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources..
Docs.summary: Following standard framework guideline dispose pattern. Shut down logging service if the project collection owns one, in order to shut down the logger thread and loggers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Follows the garbage disposal guidelines of .NET.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string Escape(string unescapedString) cil managed
Public Shared Function Escape (unescapedString As String) As String

Docs.param: The string to be converted.
Docs.summary: Escape a string using MSBuild escaping format. For example, "%3b" for ";". Only characters that are especially significant to MSBuild parsing are escaped. Callers can use this method to make a string safe to be parsed to other methods that would otherwise expand it; or to make a string safe to be written to a project file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, "%3b" for ";". Only characters that are especially significant to MSBuild parsing are converted. Callers can use this method to make a string safe to be parsed by other methods that would otherwise expand it. Callers can also use this method to make a string safe to be written to a project file.

The ToolsVersion from the project file. May be null

Public Function GetLoadedProjects (fullPath As String) As ICollection(Of Project)

Docs.param: The path to a project file to be matched.
Docs.summary: Returns any and all loaded projects with the provided path. There may be more than one, if they are distinguished by global properties and/or tools version.
Docs.returns: All projects whose project path matches the given path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks There may be more than one project with the given path because projects are also distinguished by global properties and/or tools version.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property GlobalProjectCollection As ProjectCollection

Docs.summary: Retrieves the global project collection object. This is a singleton project collection with no global properties or loggers that reads toolset information from the configuration file and registry. May throw InvalidToolsetDefinitionException. Thread safe.
Docs.value: The global project collection object. This is a singleton project collection with no global properties or loggers. Toolset information is obtained from the configuration file and registry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Thread safe.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property GlobalProperties As IDictionary(Of String, String)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::String ^, System::String ^> ^ GlobalProperties { System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::String ^, System::String ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns default global properties for all projects in this collection. Read-only dead dictionary.
Docs.value: The read-only default global properties for all projects in this collection.
Docs.remarks:
This is the publicly exposed getter, that translates into a read-only dead IDictionary<string, string>.
To be consistent with Project, setting and removing global properties is done with SetGlobalProperty and RemoveGlobalProperty.

Attribute.AttributeName: set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Object exposing host services to tasks during builds of projects contained by this project collection. By default, HostServices is used. May be set to null, but the getter will create a new instance in that case.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, returns <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.HostServices%2A>, which may be null.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsBuildEnabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsBuildEnabled : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough
set: System.Diagnostics.DebuggerStepThrough
get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: This is the default value used by newly created projects for whether or not the building of projects is enabled. This is for security purposes in case a host wants to closely control which projects it allows to run targets/tasks.
Docs.value: if the targets and tasks of projects in this project collection can be built; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Can be used for security purposes. By default, a new project has the same IsBuildEnabled setting as the parent project collection that contains it. When IsBuildEnabled is false, the Build method on this project fails.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property LoadedProjects As ICollection(Of Project)

Docs.summary: All the projects currently loaded into this collection. Each has a unique combination of path, global properties, and tools version.
Docs.value: All the projects currently loaded into this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each project has a unique combination of path, global properties, and tools version.

Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code in the given project file. The source code is evaluated with the global properties and tools version of this project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .NET Framework 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(string fileName) cil managed
Public Function LoadProject (fileName As String) As Project

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The project file to load
Docs.summary: Loads a project with the specified filename, using the collection's global properties and tools version. If a matching project is already loaded, it will be returned, otherwise a new project will be loaded.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .NET Framework 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

Docs.param: Xml reader to read project from
Docs.summary: Loads a project with the specified reader, using the collection's global properties and tools version. The project will be added to this project collection when it is named.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The project is added to this project collection when either this project or the given project root is given the full path to a project file.
In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .NET Framework 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnloadAllProjects() cil managed

Docs.summary: Unloads all the projects contained by this ProjectCollection. Host should call this when they are completely done with all the projects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The host should call this method when it no longer needs the projects.

Docs.summary: Removes a project root element from the project root cache.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnloadProject(class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement projectRootElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The project XML root element to unload.
Docs.summary: Unloads a project XML root element from the weak cache.
Docs.remarks: This method is useful for the case where the host knows that all projects using this XML element are unloaded, and desires to discard any unsaved changes.
Docs.exception: Thrown if the project XML root element to unload is still in use by a loaded project or its imports.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnloadProject(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project project) cil managed

Docs.param: The project to remove.
Docs.summary: Unloads the specific project specified. Host should call this when they are completely done with the project. If project was not already loaded, throws InvalidOperationException.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The host should call this method when it no longer needs the project.
Throws InvalidOperationException if the given project is not present in the project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnregisterAllLoggers() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all loggers from the collection of loggers used for builds of projects in this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Version As Version
public: static property Version ^ Version { Version ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the file version of the file in which the Engine assembly lies.
Docs.value: The file version of the assembly file that contains the MSBuild engine.
Docs.remarks: This is the Windows file version (specifically the value of the FileVersion resource), not necessarily the assembly version. If you want the assembly version, use Constants.AssemblyVersion. This is not the ToolsetCollectionVersion.
